greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 1 if the maximal exponent in the prime factorization of the arithmetic derivative of n (A003415) is less than the maximal exponent in n, otherwise 0. a(1) = 1 by convention.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: a(n) = [A328311(n) == 0], where [ ] is the Iverson bracket.
For n > 1, a(n) = 1 if A342003(n) < A051903(n), otherwise 0.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 01 2021
